title: 110_hr3948
content:
The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" establishes a temporary Iraq War surtax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" introduces a temporary Iraq War surtax in 2008, increasing tax liability for joint returns. The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" introduces a temporary Iraq War surtax in 2008, increasing tax liability for joint returns. The surtax rates are as follows: 2.5% for income tax liability under $10,600, $265 plus 5% for income between $10,600 and $22,600, $865 plus 11% for income between $22,600 and $36,400, and $2,383 plus 16% for income over $36,400. The tax imposed under the "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" increases for individuals, trusts, and estates with net income tax liability, with a surtax of $2,383 plus 16% of the excess over $36,400. The surtax rates based on net income tax liability are as follows:
- Not over $5,300: 2.5% of net income tax liability
- Over $5,300 but not over $11,300: $132.50, plus 5% of the excess over $5,300
- Over $11,300 but not over $18,200: $432.50, plus 11% of the excess over $11,300
- Over $18,200: $1,191.50, plus 16% of the excess over $18,200 The tax imposed on corporations under this chapter is increased by 16% of their net income tax liability. Certain exceptions related to military service apply to individuals. Certain exceptions related to military service apply to individuals, such as members of the Armed Forces receiving excludible compensation or individuals receiving a death gratuity under chapter 75 of title 10. Individuals who received a death gratuity under chapter 75 of title 10, United States Code, for a decedent who died on or after September 11, 2001, may be eligible for certain tax benefits. The tax law defines net income tax liability as the excess of the regular tax liability over the adjusted gross income, with an exception for individuals with adjusted gross income not exceeding $30,000. The term 'net income tax liability' is defined as the excess of regular tax liability and tax imposed by section 55, minus credits allowed under part IV. The tax imposed under this part is not considered tax imposed by this chapter for certain purposes. The Temporary Iraq War Surtax, effective after December 31, 2007, does not change tax rates for section 15 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
